title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

  • Decimal approximations must be correct to three places after the decimal point by rounding or truncating. Decimal values of 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ in final digits need not be reported ( 2.000=2.00=2.0=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4570@ ).

  • A decimal presentation error occurs when a response is complete and correct, but the answer is reported to fewer digits than required.

  • The first decimal presentation error in this question does not earn the point. For each additional part of this question that requires a decimal approximation and contains a decimal presentation error, the response is eligible to earn the point.
descriptions:
The student response includes none of these criteria.

  • Average rate of change in (i) as a decimal approximation, with supporting work that includes a quotient that uses the given data values. Units are not needed and are ignored if presented.

  • Estimate in (ii) using average rate of change from (i) with supporting work. NOTES:

    • If (i) has a decimal presentation error, the reported value in (i) as the average rate of change can be used to arrive at an estimate in (ii). To earn the point, the estimate in (ii) must be consistent with both the reported value in (i) and the endpoint used in the supporting work in (ii).

    • If (i) is incorrect, the reported value in (i) as the average rate of change can be used to arrive at an estimate in (ii). To earn the point, the estimate in (ii) must be consistent with both the reported value in (i) and the endpoint used in the supporting work in (ii).

  • Answer with explanation in (iii). The reasoning must include two components.

    • The graph of F MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGgbaaaa@39C7@ is concave up OR the rate of change of F MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGgbaaaa@39C7@ is increasing AND

  • Two components when neither point in (i) or (ii) is earned. One of the following:

    • Correct quotient in (i) that uses the given data values that is not expressed as a decimal approximation

    • Correct quotient in (i) that uses the given data values and has a decimal presentation error

    • Correct average rate of change in (i) that does not include supporting work

    AND One of the following:

    • Correct estimate in (ii) that does not include supporting work

    • Correct supporting work in (ii) that does not provide an estimate
